name: Araknos, the Shadow Weaver (Hunting Spider)

specials.name: Hunting Spider Venom
specials.description: Saving Throw: DC 17 Fortitude Maximum Duration: 6 rounds Stage 1: 1d4 poison damage and off-guard (1 round); Stage 2 1d6 poison damage, clumsy 1, and off-guard (1 round); Stage 3 1d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and off-guard (1 round)

specials.name: Shadow Blend
specials.description: Effect: Araknos blends into the shadows, gaining concealment until the start of its next turn.

specials.name: Leap Attack
specials.description: Effect: Araknos leaps up to 20 feet and makes a Fang Strike at the end of the leap. If the attack hits, it deals an additional 1d6 precision damage.

specials.name: Wall Crawler
specials.description: Effect: Araknos can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without needing to attempt an Athletics check.

specials.name: Ambush Predator
specials.description: Effect: Araknos gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks in dim light or darkness.

specials.name: Web Trap
specials.description: Effect: Araknos shoots a web at a 10-foot-square area within 30 feet. The area becomes difficult terrain, and creatures entering or starting their turn in the area must succeed at a DC 17 Reflex save or become immobilized for 1 round.

description:
Hunting spiders are the most common type of giant spider, though not the largest but for a reason unbeknownst to all Araknos, the Shadow Reaver is the largest mightyest to be discovered in the Evolving Labyrinth. Perhaps it was unknown magic energies passively being emitted by the Labyrinth or perhaps it is something far more sinister.

Recall Knowledge - Animal (Nature): DC 15
Unspecific Lore: DC 13
Specific Lore: DC 10

**Tactics**
*Opening Moves* Araknos uses Web Trap to control the battlefield and hinder opponents' movement.
*Combat Strategy* It utilizes Shadow Blend to gain concealment and Leap Attack to strike vulnerable targets.
*Defense* Relies on Wall Crawler to navigate the terrain and Ambush Predator to remain hidden until ready to strike.
